text: Improvement Pill here.

By the end of this video, you'll understand
exactly how you can gain the ability to predict
the future.
Now – I'm being 100% serious.

If you sit down and think about it, there
are actually a fair amount of people on this
planet right now who can predict the future.

They may not get it right all the time, but
they can predict what will happen much more
accurately than most other people.

And these so called seers, these oracles,
these prophets, are the ones who end up in

positions of power, they are the ones who
end up making a lot of money, having a lot

of influence, and living healthier and happier
lives.

They have what I like to call drum roll....
“the ability to see how things will work
out”.

See - When we're born into this world we immediately
start learning about how things work.

We learn that if we put our hand on something
too hot that we'll get burnt.

We learn that we shouldn't make a mess when
we eat because then we'll get yelled at by
our parents.

We learn that if we do something bad to someone
else, like punching them - then they'll do
something bad back to us.

The truth of the matter is everyone has developed
the ability to see how things will work out
– to some degree.

But what separates the average person from
those that become massively successful is
the extent of this ability.

Most people can only see a couple of minutes
or days into the future.

Most people are only conscious of the immediate
effects of their actions.

A burnt hand happens seconds after you touch
a hot stove.

An angry parent happens minutes after you
trash the house.

A speeding ticket arrives days after you're
bump in with the law.

The people that become super successful are
on another level when it comes to their ability
to see how things will work out.

They are able to see months and even years
into the future.

They can accurately see the results of their
actions far down the line.
And this is a very very powerful skill.

As it can get you to places you want to be
and also help you avoid bad situations.

Here's an example of this skill bringing you
to a place you want to be:

So - I've been telling people (especially
my friends and colleges) for years that they

should learn more about digital marketing
(which is essentially marketing on social

media platforms like google, youtube, and
instagram).

I found out about the field in 2015 and I
instantly knew that if I dedicated time and

energy into becoming a good digital marketer,
that I would be in a very good position a
couple of years down the line.

And here I am with a profitable online business
built on the back of my digital marketing
skills.

I was able to predict that digital marketing
would be huge in the future.
AND IT IS

If you'd like to learn more about digital
marketing (which I highly suggest you do,

because it's a field that's just going to
keep on growing) then you can learn more about
it using the link in the description box below.

Now here's an example of someone who hasn't
developed their ability to see how things
will work out:

So - An acquaintance of mine approached me
a couple of years ago with a business idea.
He wanted to launch a coupon app.

I listened and based on what I could see combined
with his skill level at the time, I told him
that his business was bound to fail.

I suggested that he work on his marketing
and sales skills before pulling the trigger
and going all in on this project.
He ignored my warning and here are the results.
The business was a complete flop.

He wasted 2 years of his life and tens of
thousands of dollars.

All because he was unable to accurately predict
the future of his actions.

People who can accurately see into the future
live wealthier, healthier, and happier lives

because they know what things to avoid and
what things to spend more time on.

It's without a doubt that it's one of the
most powerful skills you should be developing.

Now the question remains how can we increase
the length of time of which we can see into
the future – accurately.

And I'm going to stress the word accurately,
because as you saw in my previous example

there are tons of people out there who think
they can see into the future, but their prediction
is usually way off.
Here's the answer.

See the world we live in is very very very
complicated.

There are countless fields and things you
can learn about all with dozens of their own
rules and laws.

For example in physics there's the law of
gravity and the law of motion.
In business there's the 80/20 rule.

In cooking there's rules on how to oil the
pan.
Ect.
Every single field has certain rules.

And if you understand those rules you can
predict what will happen.

You can predict that your food will get burnt
if you don't oil the pan.

You can predict that a pen will drop because
of gravity.
However, the thing about real life problems.
Is that they usually encompass many fields.

Using the example of my acquaintance who wanted
to start his own business.

There are so many things we have to consider
in order to predict what will happen.
We would need to know the following:

What are the rules related to someones personality
that can predict success.

What are the rules related to a good product
that can predict success.

What are the rules related to running a business
that can predict successful

What are the rules related to marketing that
can predict success.

We would have to keep all of these things
in consideration in order to make an accurate
prediction for this problem.

People who are unable to make accurate predictions
about the future aren't able to step back
and look at the big picture.

They don't see how many rules they need to
understand in order to make the right prediction.
My acquaintance knew that he was a hard worker.

So he assumed by just knowing the rules for
personality that he would find success.

When in reality there were so many other things
he should have considered.

Had he asked himself whether or not he understood
marketing and business then maybe the results
would have been different.
Now if there are so many fields out there.

And so many rules we need to learn in order
to make right predictions – to the point

where it's not really possible to learn everything
in just one lifespan.

What strategy should we use to increase our
knowledge?

What should we do in order to gain the ability
to predict the future?

Well - The best way for me to describe this
it is through a little exercise.

I want you to imagine that this circle represents
a box with something inside of it.

In order to predict the future you must be
able to figure out what's inside the box.
What's inside changes for every unique problem.

Now If you dedicate time and energy into learning
more about one field, and you understand the

rules, then you will have opened up a little
hole on this box from which you can look through.

But one hole is usually not enough to tell
what's in the box.

All I can tell from this hole is that I see
some fur.

But if you learn more about other fields and
their rules you'll be able to see what's in
the box from a different angle.
This time I see a pair of ears.

We open up another hole I see whiskers and
a face.

If you understand the rules for enough things
and enough fields.

Then you will have enough holes to be able
to tell what's inside the box fairly accurately.
In this case it's a cat.

The beautiful thing about this world we live
in is that every single field is connected
somehow.

Math is connected to music which is connected
to nature which is connected to science which
is connected to business and finance.

Many of the rules will repeat themselves or
share similarities.

So when you learn more about math you will
learn a bit about music and business at the
same time.

The more fields you learn about the more holes
you will open up.

The more holes you open up, the better of
a view you will have of whatever is inside
the box.

If you want to become wise which if you think
about it is just the ability to predict the

future and make better decisions then you
need to cast a wide net and learn about the
rules of many different things.

This means watching random documentaries,
Spending time honing different skills, traveling

the world to see different places, and most
importantly reading books about different

subjects which brings us to the sponsors of
today's episode Audible.

If you want to be able to see into the future
you must be actively consuming information
about different topics.
This means you gotta read nonfiction books.

Audible is a great way for you to consume
all the information in books while you're
busy doing other things.

I personally love using them whenever I'm
commuting to places or when I'm doing my chores.

Go to www.audible.com/improvementpill or text
‘improvementpill’ to 500-500 to get an

exclusive 30 day free trial and a book of
your choice for absolutely free.

I highly suggest you guys to listen to Jordan
Peterson's newest book 12 Rules Of Life, which
just came out on Audible.

It does a really really good job teaching
you about the rules in a wide variety of fields.

Including nature, sports, parenting, and much
much more.
Besides that guys stay tuned.
